**The Discovery of Penicillin**: If I could change one historical event, I would go back in time to the 1920s and alter the discovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming. Fleming accidentally left a petri dish of bacteria uncovered, and upon his return, he observed that the bacteria had been killed by a mold. However, instead of being careless, Fleming had been meticulously documenting his experiments and had left the petri dish uncovered as an intentional experiment to test the effects of mold on bacteria. This would have led to a more controlled and scientific understanding of the discovery, potentially accelerating the development of antibiotics and saving countless lives.

**The Great Fire of London**: I would change the Great Fire of London in 1666, which destroyed much of the city. By preventing the fire from spreading, I would have allowed the city to maintain its medieval architecture and cultural heritage. This would have preserved the historic character of the city, potentially altering the course of urban planning and architecture in Europe. The fire led to significant changes in building codes and urban planning, but it also destroyed a significant portion of the city's cultural and historical significance.

**The Wright Brothers' First Flight**: If I could change one historical event, I would go back in time to 1903 and alter the Wright Brothers' first powered flight. Instead of being a private experiment, the Wright Brothers had invited the press and public to witness their achievement. This would have allowed the world to witness the significance of the event firsthand, potentially accelerating the development of aviation and changing the course of transportation and global connectivity.

**The Construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza**: I would change the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza, which was built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu around 2580 BC. By altering the construction process, I would have made it more sustainable and environmentally friendly. The Great Pyramid's construction required the labor of thousands of workers and is estimated to have taken around 20 years to complete. By using more efficient and sustainable methods, the pyramid could have been built in a shorter timeframe, potentially reducing the environmental impact of the construction process.

**The Invention of the Printing Press**: If I could change one historical event, I would go back in time to the 15th century and alter the invention of the printing press by Johannes Gutenberg. Instead of being a slow and laborious process, the printing press would have been designed with the ability to print multiple colors and complex designs
